definition: mutual exchange of assistance (idiom)/to reciprocate with material assistance
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: Peace-loving working people welcome “mutual supply of what the other party needs”.
sentences.chinese: 和平劳动的人民，是欢迎这种“有无相通”的。

definition: butchering one another as fish and flesh (idiom); killing one another/internecine strife
close and distant, rich and poor (idiom); everyone/all possible relations
lit. friends for a day (idiom)/fig. casual acquaintance
see 父慈子孝[fu4 ci2 zi3 xiao4]
no matter how big or small/not distinguishing junior and senior
